action.action-desc: Mr. Neugebauer introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to make the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection an independent agency.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection Accountability and Transparency Act of 2013.

section.header: Making the Bureau an independent agency
section.text: The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking in the Federal Reserve System, ; and
in subsection (e), by striking , including in cities in which the Federal reserve banks, or branches of such banks, are located,;

paragraph.text: in section 1012(c), by striking paragraphs (2), (3), (4), and (5); and
in section 1014(b), by striking Not fewer than 6 members shall be appointed upon the recommendation of the regional Federal Reserve Bank Presidents, on a rotating basis..

section.header: Bringing the Bureau into the regular appropriations process
section.text: Section 1017 of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended—

subparagraph.text: by amending the heading of such subsection to read as follows: Budget, financial management, and audit.—;
by redesignating paragraphs (4) and (5) as paragraphs (1) and (2), respectively; and
by striking subparagraphs (E) and (F) of paragraph (1), as so redesignated;

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (d) and (e) as subsections (b) and (c), respectively; and

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraphs (1), (2), and (3) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out this title for each of fiscal years 2014 and 2015.
